hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#Set the below parameters manually package_name="elasticsearch" published_version="6.2.2"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
export WORK_DIR=`pwd` #Install Build Dependencies sudo -E apt-get update cat /etc/issue sudo -E apt-get install -y tar wget unzip curl maven git make automake autoconf libtool patch libx11-dev libxt-dev pkg-config texinfo locales-all ant hostname
#Install AdoptJDK cd $WORK_DIR wget https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk9-releases/releases/download/jdk-9%2B181/OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz tar -xvf OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz export JAVA_HOME=$WORK_DIR/jdk-9+181/ export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH java -version
#Set the environment variable unset JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS export LANG="en_US.UTF-8" export JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS="-Dfile.encoding=UTF8" export _JAVA_OPTIONS="-Xmx10g"
# Download Elasticsearch source code cd $WORK_DIR sudo rm -rf elasticsearch git clone https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch cd elasticsearch git checkout v6.2.2
#Build Package ./gradlew assemble
## Run Network test cases cd $WORK_DIR/elasticsearch ./gradlew test --continue -Dtests.haltonfailure=false -Dtests.es.node.mode=network 2>&1 | tee -a network_test_log
# Run Local test cases cd $WORK_DIR/elasticsearch ./gradlew test --continue -Dtests.haltonfailure=false -Dtests.es.node.mode=local 2>&1 | tee -a local_test_log
#Verification Steps cd $WORK_DIR/elasticsearch sudo tar -C /usr/share/ -xf distribution/tar/build/distributions/elasticsearch-6.2.2-SNAPSHOT.tar.gz sudo rm -rf /usr/share/elasticsearch sudo mv /usr/share/elasticsearch-6.2.2-SNAPSHOT /usr/share/elasticsearch
#Start Elastic Search Server sudo chown test:test -R /usr/share/elasticsearch /usr/share/elasticsearch/bin/elasticsearch --version | grep 6.2.2 nohup /usr/share/elasticsearch/bin/elasticsearch & sleep 30s curl http://localhost:9200/
ps -aef
pgrep -d" " -f "elasticsearch" | xargs kill;
ps -aef
